isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS CELECT - 1992-1993 - ELECTRICAL OPERATION

svcproc.title: ENGINE ELECTRONIC CONTROL MODULE (ECM)
svcproc.para: The ECM receives battery power at all times and ignition power when the key is on.

ECM battery power is supplied at all times from the cranking motor terminal. Circuits 97 and 97A deliver power on the International harness through the ECM Power Connector (310) and the Cummins harness to the ECM. The Cummins harness has a 10A in-line fuse in each circuit. Refer to Battery Power to ECM Test for illustration of this circuit.
The ECM ground is through the Cummins harness, ECM Power Harness Connector (310) and circuit 97-G to the cranking motor to ground.
With the ignition key in the IGN position, ignition power from J2 ignition feed stud and B3 circuit breaker is supplied through the ECM 9-way connector to the ECM.
